alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne; Kit Carson County; Yuma (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued December 01 at 11:19AM MST until December 02 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Red Flag Warning Issued For Northeast Colorado and Northwest Kansas... .A combination of warm temperatures, low RH values and windy conditions will lead to critical fire weather conditions Friday. Gusty westerly winds will be present across the warning area before shifting to the NW behind a cold front; winds will become stronger behind the cold front potentially gusting up to 60 mph. Blowing dust may be possible during the afternoon with perhaps a wall of dust along the cold front. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 5 PM MST FRIDAY FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 001, 002, 003, 004, 013, 014, 015, 016, 252, 253, AND 254... The National Weather Service in Goodland has issued a Red Flag Warning for wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect from 11 AM to 5 PM MST Friday. * Affected Area...In Colorado, Fire Weather Zone 252 Yuma, Fire Weather Zone 253 Kit Carson and Fire Weather Zone 254 Cheyenne. In Kansas, Fire Weather Zone 001 Cheyenne, Fire Weather Zone 002 Rawlins, Fire Weather Zone 003 Decatur, Fire Weather Zone 004 Norton, Fire Weather Zone 013 Sherman, Fire Weather Zone 014 Thomas, Fire Weather Zone 015 Sheridan and Fire Weather Zone 016 Graham. * Winds...Northwest 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 60 mph. * Relative Humidity...As low as 19 percent. * Impacts...Any fires that start will have extreme fire behavior and spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not advised.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now...or are imminent. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
